summary: An FBI Threat Intake Examiner forwards a public tip from April 15, 2020, reporting a sighting of fugitive Ghislaine Maxwell in Richmond Hill, Ontario, Canada. The tipster describes Maxwell allegedly playing with two children in a forested area and connects the sighting to a parked Mini Cooper and the unrelated murder of a philanthropist in Toronto.

keyFacts: A public tip submitted to the FBI on April 15, 2020, reported a sighting of fugitive Ghislaine Maxwell in Richmond Hill, Ontario, Canada.
The tip described Maxwell allegedly playing hide and seek with two children (approx. 9 and 13 years old) in a forested area on April 13, 2020, with a child heard calling 'Gislain'.
A red Mini Cooper (license plate CCRP 921) was reported parked at 294 Thornhill Woods Drive from April 10-14, 2020, and was associated with the sighting.
The tipster, Bergman, connected the sighting to the unrelated murder of philanthropist Paul Morgan in Toronto, speculating a possible link to the 'Epstien Maxwell organisation'.
The FBI Threat Intake Examiner forwarded the tip to the New York Division for situational awareness, noting the tipster provided no personally identifiable information.
